content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the cleaned version of it. The `replace` function replaces all spaces and hyphens in the string with underscores, while the `lowercase` function converts all characters to lowercase and the `strip` function removes any leading or trailing whitespaces.
